snippet: Producer prices in the United States rose more than expected in September, a government report showed, but underlying inflation pressures were muted.
abstract: Thomson Reuters/University of Michigan's preliminary October reading of overall index on consumer sentiment comes in at 83.1, up from 78.3 in September, its highest level since September 2007; Labor Department reports that its seasonally adjusted Producer Price Index increased by a higher-than-expected 1.1 percent in September.
lead_paragraph: Producer prices in the United States rose more than expected in September, a government report showed, but underlying inflation pressures were muted.

headline.seo: U.S. Consumer Sentiment Jumps to a 5-Year High
headline.main: U.S. Consumer Sentiment Jumps to a 5-Year High
headline.print_headline: U.S. Consumer Sentiment Jumps to a 5-Year High
